subject: Home & DIY
title: How a Furnace Heats Your Home
description: Learn How a Furnace Heats Your Home in one minute.

hook.text: Your thermostat calls for heat. Within 60 seconds, warm air flows from vents across the house. What happens in between?

buildup.text: A gas furnace lights burners in a sealed chamber. The flame heats a metal heat exchanger to 65Â°C or more.

discovery.text: A blower fan pushes house air across the heat exchanger's surface, warming it before sending it through ductwork.

twist.text: Combustion gases exit through a flue, never touching your air. A cracked heat exchanger leaks deadly carbon monoxide.

climax.text: Condensing furnaces capture heat from exhaust vapor, hitting 98% efficiency. Older models waste 30% up the flue.

punchline.text: You breathe room air. The flame has its own exit.

quiz.question: Why is a cracked heat exchanger dangerous?
options: It can leak carbon monoxide into your living space
It causes the furnace to overheat and catch fire
It allows cold air to enter the system
